title: Emails read in Gmail app don't download to Thunderbird
content:

I would like when I delete mail via Thunderbird that it be deleted from the server. I do not delete them from my phone. I only preview.

Is there a setting in Thunderbird to allow read email to download or would it wreak havoc? My workaround is to mark emails unread from within the gmail app.

title: 128.6.0esr (64 bit) cannot send or receive mail, but accesses calendar and contacts
content:
Thunderbird 128.6.0esr (64 bit) can obtain access to my Google Calendar and Contacts but not to email. This is a clean installation on a brand new Windows 11 computer. I have reinstalled Thunderbird three times, deleted saved passwords, deleted only the SMTP and IMAP saved passwords (preserving OAuth2 passwords), deleted Thunderbird's access in Gmail security settings to force it to re-request access, followed every instruction on every forum and help page I can find, but Thunderbird refuses to send and receive mail. Thunderbird finds the correct configuration and sets it up (correct ports, IMAP, SMTP, correct servers, OAuth2, etc.) I used my Gmail address and the same password as I use for webmail.

I am presently using Outlook for Gmail because it connected immediately using the same credentials as I am trying with Thunderbird. When I delete access permission in Gmail security settings, then add Gmail to Thunderbird again, it prompts for access to Contacts and Calendar but not to mail (one time it flashed a screen saying it could not because Java is not enabled in my web browser--but Java is enabled on both my default browser, Edge, and on Chrome; the page that came up appears to be some internal browser in Thunderbird).

The attached images show the configurations for IMAP server, the SMTP server, and that the saved passwords contain two OAuth2 URLs, one for contacts and the other for the calendar, but nothing for mail.

I have been using Thunderbird for years, and have a massive archive of emails in it, would really like to use it as my email client rather than Outlook. Installation and configuration has never been this difficult. Does anybody have any thoughts on what to do next?
creator: allanpmustard

title: Thunderbird Unified inbox is showing mesages that are not in the inbox, but are in sub folders
content:
I have four different email accounts.

There is one however that it has no messages in its inbox. Yet, it has about 200 messages in various sub folders.

When I click on my unified inbox, all of the messages that are in the sub folders are showing up in the inbox.

If I select them and try and drag them into their own sub folders, the drop highlight disappears. It only allows them to be dropped into other folders, not the ones that they should be in.

This indicates that they are actually in those folders. To test this I can click on those sub folders and see the messages in there, as well as in the main unified inbox.

I removed the account and all associated data, and re-added this again. The exact same problem happened.

Can anyone suggest anything I can try to fix this behavior so that the messages in the sub folders do not appear in the unified inbox?

Thank you so much, any help would be appreciated.

title: Restore profile error
content:
Hi,

My HDD was broken and I swtichted to a new one, reinstalling all from zero. I have a Thunderbird profile backup, but when I restored it in AppData\Local and AppData\Roaming it doesn't work well. It has recovered my Local mails, but the extensions are not working: they have missing icons, I can't access addon's options, etc...

I see in the Console many errors, some of them refering to the old profile folder (Users/OldUser), that now have changed (Users/NewProfile). I changed some manually and something have been fixed (now, the addons have icons), but not totally, because the addons didn't work yet. In console window I can see many errors like: Unable to load script: moz-extension://6281a2e3-c9c1-4510-9901-66f3e26dfb67/content/thunderbird/content.js

Which is the best way to restore the profile folder?

Thx

title: Access to my email account.
content:
2025 01 23

Dear Sir,

I have asked for help before, but the issue persists, probably due to my lack of computer science.

My email address is

malcolm@malcolmgmiller.biz

but as I cannot access my account please respond to

malcolm_g_miller@hotmail.com

I was instructed to leave Heart Internet and transfer to Thunderbird. I had no choice. I was happy at Heart Internet, had no problems, accessed my emails both on my laptop and my Apple cellphone.

Since the change to your group, I have never had access to my emails on my cellphone, which is an Apple 16 Pro Max. I rarely have access to my emails on my laptop.

I have your documents "CloudTech 24 Email Setup on iOS" and "CloudTech24 Email, Setup on Laptop with Thunderbird". Despite numerous attempts I am unable to access via my cellphone and only occasionally via my laptop. As of the day before yesterday I cannot access via my laptop.

I have changed my password through your system but neither my new, or previous, passwords allow me access.

Please resolve my problems so that I once again may access my emails on my cellphone and laptop.

Alternatively, please transfer my account back to Heart Internet, or another operator that will provide me with continuous access to my emails.

Yours faithfully,

Malcolm G. Miller. malcolm@malcolmgmiller.biz (Temporarily out of service). malcolm_g_miller@hotmail.com (Until my main email address is again operable). 07710550829

title: DUNAM CYBER SOLUTION BTC-ETH RECOVERY EXPERT
content:
I had tried to secure my Bitcoin wallet, maybe a bit too aggressively, enabling every security feature imaginable: two-factor authentication, biometric verification, intricate passwords-the whole shebang. I wanted to make it impossible for anybody to get to my money. I tried to make this impregnable fortress of security and ended up locking myself out of my wallet with $700,000 in Bitcoin.

It wasn't until I tried to access my wallet that I realized the trap I had set for myself. I was greeted with an endless series of security checks-passwords, codes, facial recognition, and more. I could remember parts of my multi-layered security setup but not enough to actually get in. In fact, my money was behind this digital fortress, and the more I tried to fix it, the worse it seemed to get. I kept tripping over my own layers of protection, unable to find a way back in. Panic quickly set in when I realized I had made it almost impossible for myself to access my own money.

That is when I called DUNAMIS CYBER SOLUTION From that very first call, they reassured me that I wasn't the first person to make this kind of mistake and certainly wouldn't be the last. They listened attentively to my explanation and got to work straight away. Their team methodically began to untangle my overly complicated setup. Patience and expertise managed to crack each layer of security step by step until they had restored access to my wallet.

Dunamiscyber@solution4u.com +13433030545 contact@dunamiscybersolution.com

title: Thunderbird account doesn't retrieves mail correctly
content:
Hello,

my Thunderbird account doesn't retrieves my mail correctly. I have four accounts with the provider Mail.de. Since round about three weeks Thunderbird retrieves all these mails just over night. During the day I receive them just sporadically or not at all - even when I try to retrieve them manually. Also Thunderbird will not synchronise my mail accounts on my phone, tablet and notebook. When I log in with my mail provider I have no problems. The mails are there and I can open and read them. But Thunderbird will not retrieve them. I'm able to send mails but they are not copied into the sent folder and/or I get a error message that they could not be saved in the sent folder or not be sent at all. So I'm never sure if they are sent or not. My google mail account has no problem. With that one I can send and receive mails with Thundrbird without problems.

I contacted my mail provider Mail.de but they said, with my accounts is everything allright. So the problem has to be with Thunderbird. The selfdiagnosis of Thunderbird shows no errors.

I hope very much that you are able to help me. I have Thunderbrid since years and I'm very happy with this program. When you need further information for the bug-fix let me know please.

Sincerely
